name: Paraneoplastic Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder (PNMOSD)
chief_complaint: I've been having blurry vision, weakness in my legs, and episodes of nausea for weeks.
physical_findings: decreased muscle strength (3/5) in lower extremities
prognosis: Guarded; dependent on tumor control and neurological damage. Early intervention improves outcomes but relapses are common.
description: A rare paraneoplastic syndrome where autoantibodies against aquaporin-4 (AQP4-IgG) cross-react with both neural tissue and occult malignancy, causing simultaneous demyelination of optic nerves and spinal cord. Distinguished from classic NMO by its neoplastic association.
